title: all rounder
body:
Hello people
I want to know what's  the noob friendly champ for mid, jungle, and adc?
I usually play support or top but trying not to touch others cos have no idea how to play it, so I want to ask people which champ are noob friendly for these lanes.
that way I can start to learn a bit more

replies.body:
Jg, you have a mix between jax, yi and nasus. Just general farm heavy champs that teach you the basics of clearing, vision control and counter jgling (because those come with the farming alone)

Mid lane everyone says kat but I would recommend Diana, otherwise you just need to deal with the high skill cap in mid lane

Adc is a tough one because there is really no "nooby" champ to make things easy as the role itself hovers around the same skill cap no matter who you are playing. But as a beginner go for Ashe because her utility is incredibly useful in keeping you alive and winning trades, plus you learn to play safe with her lack of mobility and as a result you can work on basic farming and trading

thanks so now I just pick what champ to go for and what their guide from online and go from there? or I need to watch people play from twitch?

It is really up to you, I learn my favourite champs by watching others and getting advice but I learn the basics just by playing them. Then when I kinda like the champ I get a guide.

For you I would just get a guide and roll with that for your first two games then see how you go
as for mid is there any range one?

Ranged his hard because most ranged mages fall short when they get rushed by say the jgler. Melee's have versatility in the form of "I have no danger zone that I want to keep you out of" limiting their weakness, Diana with her aoe grab and gap closer makes her a great mage to fight the likes of victor and annie and her passive works around her basic attacks so she doesn't mind going toe to toe with yasuo.

Though if you need a recommendation go for annie
